title: Aldi to launch massive technology sale in store
text:
Aldi supermarkets are releasing a range of new-age technology including TVs and outdoor security cameras at a heavily reduced price.

The 'connected home' Special Buys will launch in stores across Australia from Wednesday October 30 - and like all limited edition drops - will only last a week.

A 65 inch 4K android TV is one of the largest products on offer and will be priced at a reasonable $799 with a one year warranty.

The 'connected home' Special Buys will launch in stores across Australia from Wednesday October 30 - and like all limited edition drops - will only last a week

There will also be a number of 'smart' security cameras - including one for indoors ($59.99) and one for outdoor areas ($99.99) that promise to keep your property secure.

They have a sharp 1080HD vision, infrared night vision and motion detection alerts so nothing goes unnoticed.

If you'd rather forgo the cameras and opt for an alarm there is a $99.99 kit that includes a siren which sounds and light up when sensors are triggered.

There will also be a number of 'smart' security cameras - including one for indoors ($59.99 on the right) and one for outdoor areas ($99.99 on the left) that promise to keep your property secure

You can forget the traditional doorbell and opt for the new smart video one at Aldi this week because it allows for two-way audio and you can see your guest at the door before you open it

An assortment of batteries ($9.99 for a pack of 16), LED light bulbs ($29.99 for two) and an LED light strip ($29.99) will assist in keeping your house environmentally-friendly.

You can forget the traditional doorbell and opt for the new smart video one at Aldi this week because it allows for two-way audio and you can see your guest at the door before you open it.

At $99.99 it's a steal when you consider how often you need to be alerted to deliveries and friends coming over.

The final 'smart' product preparing to make a splash is the $149 pet feeder

The final 'smart' product preparing to make a splash is the $149 pet feeder.

It connects to an app that will release food into the bowl at whatever time you desire - even if you're not at home to do so.

You can even talk to your pets via the microphone while they eat and choose the correct portion size you desire.
description: Aldi supermarkets are releasing a range of new-age technology including TVs and outdoor security cameras at a heavily reduced price.
authors: Matilda Rudd For Daily Mail Australia
